item.description:
Co-operativ children's game. The parents have been captured by pirates, and the children must free them from the bottom of the pirate ship. However, if they encounter pirates on their way, they may be forced to walk the plank, in which case they may be eliminated. If they manage to free the parents you win, but if all but one of the children are eliminated, you lose. Any player can move any playing piece, so it is not really player elimination, just playing piece elimination.

—User summary

link.value: WOW! What a World of Entertainment AB

item.description:
In Totem, players reveal each others' strengths and qualities by forming totems, combinations of an animal card (representing a strength) and a quality card. Every player contributes one animal card and one quality card to each other player's totem.

Players can earn more points if the cards that they played were considered to be especially relevant and accurate, either by the active player or by the other players. The favourite animal and quality cards for that round stay in front of the active player and become their totem. The game ends when everyone has a totem.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins, but everyone else gains something as well: a greater awareness of how others perceive and appreciate them!

Brave the Labyrinth and face the Minotaur! In this cat and mouse game, it's kill or be killed, and everyone for themselves. Dare you enter?

Based on the legend of Theseus and the Minotaur, Knossus is set in the ancient time, where 7 youths have been sent by the City of Athens, to be sacrificed to the minotaur in the labyrinth of King Minos.

It is designed to be a gateway game suitable for a family to play or as light relief between more heavyweight games. Gameplay style varies with the group - from fast and furious, action packed charging around the labyrinth, to tactical chess-like experience where strategic players face off in a game played several moves ahead.

The game plays by drawing 4 cards - you must choose two to control your hero, and two to control the Minotaur. They may be played in any order, and augmented by receiving the blessing of the gods from various shrines found in the labyrinth. There are also items to help you in your quest but you may only carry one at a time.

Balancing luck with strategy, Knossus is designed to engage the group for the whole 30 minutes - even eliminated players are still able to control the minotaur for that last sweet act of revenge. And there's nothing so satisfying as sending the monster charging into your rivals, slaying them, only to end his run on the point of your sword, winning you the game.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Recreate the Greatest Military conflict in history. Germany versus Soviet Union on the "Eastern Front" in World War 2.
Use your battle and tactic cards, to out smart your opponent, win battles during 1941-1945, gain promotion through the ranks and ultimately win the war. Who will be victorious?

Each year 7 battles are fought, whoever wins the most battles wins the year, whoever wins the most years wins the war.
Each battle the players pick one of their 7 battle cards and then players reveal them simultaneously. Highest points win.
However events, tactic and campaign cards will also affect your score.
The aim of the game is to get into your opponents mind, remember their past tactics and out think them.

The game has simple rules, easy to learn but allows for tactical decisions and be both quick and fun.

—description from the publisher

Back Alley is a variation of bridge, played with a standard deck of 52 cards including jokers. One joker should be marked 'high' and the other joker 'low'.

In the first round, one card is dealt to each of the four players. In the next round, two cards are dealt to each player, then three, four, etc. all the way up to 13 cards. Then 13 cards are dealt again and you make your way back down to 1.

In each round, remaining cards are set to the side and the topmost card is turned over to reveal the trump suit. After the trump is set, players look at their hand and bid on how many tricks they think they can take. Bidding continues around the table in a clockwise direction until all players have bid. If a player thinks they can take all the tricks, they can board which is worth 13 points. The next player can double-board if they wish, which would be worth 24 points.

Player with the highest bid leads the first trick. All other players must follow suit if possible, or play a trump if unable to follow suit. The highest card, or highest trump cards, wins the trick. The player who won the trick leads the next card and play continues around the table until all players are out of cards.

If you meet your bid, you score three points for each trick bid and taken, plus one point for tricks greater than the bid. If the bid isn't met, it's minus one point for each trick missed. If a player boards and makes it, they score 13 points. If they board and don't get all the tricks, they get -13 points.

At the end of 26 hands, the player with the most points is the winner.

Shelfie is all about arranging your board games on the shelf. With unique goals and interest every game shelf will look different. Manage your hand of cards and utilize their powers to arrange and rearrange games on the shelf.

Place cards into your library and unlock abilities. You can swap games, move games, acquire new games, or discard games. Each player has a type of game they love and a type they hate. Secret goals along the way help give focus to how your game shelf should be arranged. At the end you'll take a shelfie and see who has the most points.

Points are awarded for alphabetical order and for shelf arrangement.

Willi the bookworm has eaten all the books and made a mess of all the letters. The players now have to clean up the mess and create new words.
Three theme cards are placed on the table, each player gets a certain amount of letters. Three letters are in the exchange area. The first player places a letter next to a theme card to start a word which fits that theme. The next player can start a new word for a different theme, or continue the current word by dding another letter. At the end of the turn, a player draws a new card.
Instead of playing a hand card, a player may take a letter from the exchange area and add it to any of the words, and must replace it from their hand. If this also doesn't work, they can discard a card. 
When a word is finished, the cards (which show a number of points depending on how often they appear in German) are put on a score pile and a new word for this theme can be started. If the players agree that it will be too hard to finish a word, they can discard the cards and start a new word.
Play continues like this until all cards have been played. Points in the discard pile are deducted from the points in the score pile, and the overall number is checked on a chart to see how well the group did.

A trivia game. Up to four players or teams can play. The players advance in a track of 42 spaces (or "kilometers", hence the name of the game) by answering questions about six main themes.

In this version of Maratón in addition it is possible to bet in the answers of the other players, which are getting lost if the answer is wrong and being able to recover moving back the player marker a space in the board.

A basic roll-and-move game with trivia found in a centerfold of the April 3rd, 1990 edition of Family Circle Magazine. Players provide dice, pawns and a quantity of small chocolate candies referred to as "Chocolate Chunks" or "cc's".

The goal of the game is to be the first to reach Finish square without any cc's. Spaces on the board can add or subtract cc's. Some spaces allow you to answer chocolate related trivia questions found in the back of the magazine to discard extra cc's.

Shiver Me Timbers is a highly thematic, strategic sandbox game set in the Golden Age of Piracy. The game is heavily Euro-inspired: It uses a tactical card-based combat system and takes lots of strategic planning to use your available actions to optimal effect and become the most notorious pirate of your era.

Each playing will vary as you randomly reveal five of ten vastly different victory conditions: One game, you'll be rescuing your lost family, the next you might have to conquer enemy ships and fortresses or face the hideous Kraken.

At the beginning of the game, each player secretly chooses two of the revealed conditions as their personal goals. After all players have chosen, they set-up the fully modular board, each of them trying to find a constellation that optimally supports their hidden agenda. Then they outfit their modable ship miniatures, select their starting abilities and equipment and set sails to fight, conquer, trade, loot, hunt for treasure and much more.

During play, every achievement is rewarded with victory points. The game continues until all five victory conditions have been met. There's a final scoring in which players collect extra points if they managed to achieve the goals they chose, and highest point total wins.

—description from the designer

name.value: クレルソンと夜明けの展覧会 (Clerson to Yoake no Tenrankai)

item.description:
Chronicles of Crime is a cooperative game of crime investigation, mixing an app, a board game and a touch of Virtual Reality.

With the same physical components (board, locations, characters and items), players will be able to play plenty of different scenarios and solve as many different crime stories.

Players start the app, choose the scenario they want to play, and follow the story. The goal being to catch the killer of the current case in the shortest short time possible.

Using the Scan&Play technology, each component (locations, characters, items, etc.) has a unique QR code, which, depending on the scenario selected, will activate and trigger different clues and stories. That means players will be able to get new stories way after the game is released simply by downloading the app's updates, without any shipping of new physical components involved.

The VR experience only requires a mobile phone. Players simply put the VR glasses (optional buy) onto their mobile device, and put the VR glasses on their nose, holding their mobile device in front of their eyes, to immerse themselves in the game's universe and search for clues in a virtual world.

The game comes with 1 tutorial and 5 scenarios, but more can be downloaded directly inside the app!
Each session last around 1h to 1h30 minutes and many scenarios are connected to each others in order to tell a much bigger story.

—description from the publisher

(Español)

Londres, en la actualidad. Acabas de dejar la oficina del Jefe de Policía. Un cuerpo ha sido hallado en Hyde Park, y tu jefe te acaba de asignar el caso. No es tu primera investigación, pero algo te dice que este caso no es como los demás. Centras tu cabeza, inicias la maquinaria y te diriges a la escena del crimen. ¡Es hora de trabajar!

Crónicas del Crimen es un juego cooperativo de investigación criminal. El uso de la tecnología Escanea & Juega mezcla los juegos digitales con los de tablero, permitiendo multitud de historias sobre investigación criminal utilizando los mismos componentes. ¡Interroga a los sospechosos, recoge pruebas, y arresta al asesino antes de que sea demasiado tarde!

Chronicles of Crime: Lizzy Promo Card

item.description:
The story of Chronicle X begins after humanity has lost control of Earth. The Grays, an alien species of spies and assassins, crippled the world’s governments, militaries and infrastructure before striking a decisive blow in the form of a full-scale invasion across the planet. All that remains to challenge the Grays is a small group of soldiers, scientists and terrorists known as Chronicle X. Players will determine if Chronicle X is victorious, and humanity is saved, or if the Grays’ tighten their grasp and Earth is lost forever.

Chronicle X is a 1-7 player board game with highly-detailed miniatures and a complex rules system ensuring no two gameplay sessions will be the same. One player takes on the role of the dreaded Overmind, high leader of an army of alien invaders known only as “the Grays.” The remaining players field members of Chronicle X, a diverse group of skilled individuals determined to save their planet against this new alien threat.

item.description:
You are the leader of the ogres group. Aim of this game is queuing your ogres (dice) a distribution stations and get a beautiful stone. Can receive stones of your choice from the player who placed the most dice at the distribution stations.

However, the demons are not very smart, so they will not move as you would expect. A player who successfully directs the ogres and get more stones than other players will win.

You participated in the uninhabited survival contest. And survived to the final.
You must collect the ingredients to create tools, and use survival skills to earn the title of the best survival expert.

This is a 2-player, small-volume card game.
You choose the action card to execute the action, and create the necessary tools for survival.
The action card consists of day and night.
Complete the tool card through resources such as fruit, trees, vines, and stones.
Win by winning 15 points.

Fat Turkey – The mini card game for 2–9 turkeys.

Farmer Jack is busy trying to fatten up his turkeys ready for market. As one of the turkeys your aim is to try and keep your weight down and avoid being selected.

Turkeys select cards from the food pile which will add to their weight. The food pile also includes cards such as Weight Loss, Poop and Feed Me which will enable turkeys to shed weight and distribute their food cards amongst other turkeys.

When Farmer Jack is selected from the food pile, the round ceases and the fattest turkey is selected for market and taken out of the game.

A strategic little card game played in rounds until only one turkey survives.

The Galápagos Islands are known worldwide as "The Enchanted Islands", a paradise of wildlife inhabited by species unique in the world, the same paradise that inspired Charles Darwin in his formulation of the Theory of Evolution — but any environmental change may disturb the delicate balance of the ecosystem that shelters these wonderful animals, putting their lives at risk!

S.O.S. Galápagos is a board game in which players take on the role of ecological activists whose mission is to rescue animals whose lives are threatened by irresponsible human activity. In order to rescue animals at risk, players must make the best possible use of their resources, which are represented by action dice and helper tokens.

The game lasts exactly twelve rounds, each of which is divided into five phases in this order:

Phase A) Threat
Phase B) Throwing the dice
Phase C) Player actions
Phase D) Resolving actions
Phase E) Preparing the next round

During a turn, a player can perform all the actions that their action dice and helper tokens allow. Through the use of both kinds of actions, players attempt to rescue animals at risk and to fight against environmental threats. At the end of the game, whoever has collected the highest number of rescue points will be declared chief rescuer and win.

The future of the Galápagos Islands is in our hands: To work, rescuers!

item.description:
The summoner has brought forth factions from distant worlds to use as pawns in our game. Take your choice of Dragons, Robots, Wild West or Zombies as you take on your opponents. Use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows and you’ll win the game.

New factions are coming soon for expanded gameplay up to 8 players!

The most basic ruleset of the game works mainly like a matching game that can be played by anyone with the ability to add to 10. Advanced rules turn this basic game into a battle of wits with chess-like decision making and strategy in nearly every card pull. Rules are available for head-to-head 2 player games, free-for-all games of 3 and up and team games. Optional rules can also be applied that change up game play and strategies

link.value: Border Tensions: Zombies vs Wild West

item.description:
Barkolana is the official game of the Barcolana, the most populous sailing regatta in the world.
The winner is the first one to arrive, sailing in his boat a course full of unexpected marine trial, which,if passed, will make him gain money (called "bori", from the name of the wind of the city "bora"). At the end of his turn, the player can use the money to buy in the "bottega velica" (a sailor's shop) some items to make his boat stronger, like new sails, gps, bottle of wine to stop other players, and even cannons to shoot them or forbidden fan or engine (he must pay attention to the sea police).
Also, in each turn the wind will change, affecting the speed of the sailing boats.

—description from the publisher

Il gioco è molto semplice: chi arriva per primo alla casella finale del tabellone, vince la Barkolana. L’avanzamento delle pedine è regolato dal lancio di dado e, a seconda della casella in cui si capita, bisognerà eseguire un compito specifico, tenendo conto del vento a favore stabilito all’inizio del turno e valido per tutti i giocatori. Il giocatore che è di mano dovrà prendere un boro (moneta triestina), utile per acquistare gli strafanici (optional di potenziamento della barca) presso la Bottega velica.
L’aspetto divertente è che per raggiungere il traguardo i velisti avranno a disposizione mezzi non sempre regolamentari: il ventilatore, un motore o i cannoni ad esempio; se avrete la sfortuna di incappare nella Guardia Costiera, dovrete pagarne il prezzo subendo le relative penalità.
Inoltre in mare dovrete sapervi destreggiare di fronte a mille difficoltà: saper recitare una filastrocca in apnea ad esempio, scommettere o mantenere il silenzio radio.
Un’ottima occasione per cimentarsi con un gioco dell’oca molto originale ed imparare qualcosa di nuovo sulle regate veliche, da provare!

Nerdando.com

SECTRE is an abstract strategy game for 2-6 players with a goal of scoring points by building shapes from colors on the board. Pattern recognition skills are sharpened as shapes are picked out in an ever-evolving tapestry of color. Plan your moves accordingly to keep your options open. Your next move will always be on the tip of your tongue; can you manage to keep it a secret?

—description from the publisher

name.value: Platoon Commander Deluxe: The Battle of Kursk

item.description:
Kursk. Many historians believe it was the turning point of World War II. Kursk. Witness to the largest tank battle of the entire war. Kursk. The end of the myth of German invincibility. Kursk. Just one hell of a lot of fun to game with 1” square cardboard counters representing platoons of infantry and tanks and batteries of anti-tank guns, mortars, and stuff. And that is what you get with Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk.

Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk (PCD:K) is the port of Tiny Battles’ well-known Platoon Commander system to Flying Pig’s big box, mounted map, large counter method of game publishing. Each game includes three mounted 22” x 17” geomorphic maps, and four sheets of thick (as in 2mm thick, wow these counters are so easy to pick up, thick, why haven’t wargames been like this forever, thick), 1” square counters. There are Tiger tanks, Panther tanks, Mk IV tanks, T-34/76 tanks, KV-1 tanks, SU-152 assault guns, infantry (rifle, guards, pioneers, submachinegun), mortar batteries, Stukas, IL-2, and more.

PCD:K uses version 2 of the Platoon Commander rules, which are identical to the V1.5 rules released with the latest Tiny Battle Publishing Platoon Commander game, Poland Strikes, with the exception of enhanced artillery and new air strike routines.

Each turn is gamed through several phases. At the beginning of each turn, the players determine initiative with a unique dice-off system in which ties award the initiative to whomever lacked it the previous turn and applying the Commander's Focus to the roll might tilt the odds in your favor. Next, players will draw a scenario-designated number (usually just one) of Action Cards that may be used for anything from artillery strikes, through rally assists, to negating the opponent's just-played card. Then it is time to rally disrupted units with a simple 1d6 roll against a nationality or scenario-designated morale. Action Cards, in addition to the special Aid chit, may be used to improve a unit's chances of preparing for combat.

And then all hell breaks lose...

It's the Fire Phase and players alternate firing with individual units or stacks of units against in-range and in-sight enemy units. When firing on the enemy tanks, the target's Armor Factor is subtracted from the firing unit's Armor Piercing Factor, two dice are rolled, and the results checked on the appropriate column on the Fire Results Table, yielding a number of potential hits. The target rolls a die for each potential hit and compares it to his or her morale. Pass the morale check, that hit is negated. These columns and die rolls can be modified by the target's terrain, flanking fire, the Focus marker (represents the commander's presence), and most importantly Action Cards, which can grant column shifts or even allow the same unit to fire again, adding a delicious uncertainty that makes the game thrilling to play. Players continue to alternate attacks until neither wishes to attack.

Next comes the Movement Phase. Unlike the preceding Fire Phase, one player moves ALL his eligible units before the opposition gets to move. Certain units can move and fire or vice versa (with a penalty), unfired opposing units can opportunity fire on enemies moving within their line of sight. As in many other facets of the game, the insightful play of Action Cards during the movement phase is critical, allowing additional movement or opportunity fire conducted by units that have already fired. No PanzerBush tactics here, you never know when a unit will be able to fire on you. Exciting stuff.

Finally, we reach the Aid and Focus Phase. Platoon Commander eschews the use of HQs that can be unrealistically targeted. Instead both players have Aid and Focus markers, representing where the commander intends to place emphasis or send additional assets (ammunition, weapons, etc) or first aid. The placement of these markers provides combat and morale bonuses to the units underneath them. Additionally, if the player chooses, the Focus marker can be used to influence the initiative roll.

And that's a turn of Platoon Commander.

So, What's Different?

I hear that a lot. With all the tactical games on the market, what makes Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk different?

Clutterless counters. PCD:K uses color to determine a weapon's range. For example, an Armor Piercing factor printed on gold indicates that the weapon can fire normally at a target up to four hexes away.
Unique phasing. Players alternate attacking in the Fire Phase, but move all their units at once during the Movement Phase.
Flanking Friendly Close Assault Phase. Units do not enter the hex of the Close Assault target, but rather attack from adjacent hexes. This allows the attacker to not only amass the overwhelming odds needed to take that key position, but also attack from multiple directions, which provide a flanking bonus. Additionally, alternating attacks in the Close Assault phase allow defenders to conduct true spoiling attacks. 
Ranged combat results are based not only an the target's armor factor and terrain, which determine the column on which the attack is executed, but also the target unit's morale which determines how many hits affected the target.
Artillery is card driven. Neither player knows the other's artillery capability by glancing at a scenario card. Artillery barrages are determined by Action Cards.
Action Cards. PCD:K is not card driven, but rather card assisted. The Action Cards provide artillery, rally units, provide combat bonuses, and even unexpected Opportunity Fire shots. 
Focus and Aid Markers. These markers allow players to influence the battle much as their real life counterparts would. Players may choose to focus on a specific area, providing combat bonuses, or provide additional aid to those disrupted by fire.

It’s a system that grognards and newbies alike can enjoy. The counters are large, easy to read, and beautifully illustrated. There is no jungle of numbers to wade through; the range at which a unit can fire is indicated by the color of the placard (badge?) behind the attack factor. Although gamers need not fiddle with unit facing, simple rules account for flanking fire. And infantry isn’t forgotten either. Platoon Commander Deluxe uses a unique system in which infantry assaults from adjacent hexes, allowing commanders to concentrate overwhelming force at a critical point and even conduct flank attacks. And woe be the Tiger platoon caught unsupported in the midst of a city by a horde of Russian rifleman.

—description from the designer

link.value: Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk – Tracks in the Mud
Platoon Commander Deluxe: The Battle for Kursk – Action Card Add-on Pack

item.description:
Meownarchy is a print to play card game of deduction luck and survival for 2-6 players. Players will assume the role of one of the royal feline noble trying to claim the throne while the king is gone. The identity of the player is unknown from the other player so everyone must be cautious in playing their cards. At the start of the game, each player receive 1 card each. At player's turn, he/she will draw another card from a shared deck then the player may choose to play the card's effect such as switching a card with another player, or forcing another player to discard his card. When a player has no cards left, he/she is eliminated from the round. The round will end when either the deck was exhausted, only one player remain, or when any player discards the king card.

—description from the designer

name.value: Kingdoms of Erden: King of the Mountain

item.description:
Kingdoms of Erden: King of the Mountain is a high fantasy card game set on the fictional planet of Erden. In the game, several factions are competing for dominance over the Kings Mountain summit.

Players take turns conquering the summit of the Mountain with characters and special items from their hand until one player achieves faction dominance by accumulating a strong enough army or until one player is left standing.

The core mechanisms of the game include hand management, set collection and card drafting. Some cards include take that elements and players can be eliminated.

INTRODUCTION:
You are a newly hired store manager, eager to show your prowess to the corporate executives. You have been given two years to successfully generate as much profit as possible, and be moved up to an executive position at the corporate office. However, you have stiff competition from other store managers who are hoping to do the same.

DESCRIPTION:
Big Box Retail is an economic game for 2-4 new store managers who have to juggle marketing, distribution, purchasing, warehousing, sales, payroll, and employees in an effort to generate the most profit as possible.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Generate the most cash by the end of two years (four rounds)

GAME PLAY:
Each player performs market research to determine customer demands, and purchases products for their store. Then, employees will manage store inventory (including new distributor purchases), and prepare for customer sales. Customers will seek out stores to meet their demand. Finally, employees are paid according to their work efforts.

GAME ELEMENTS:

 Seasonal customer demands
 End-to-End store management
 Customer overflow (indirect competition)
 Employee talents

It’s 1948, and World War II has left Germany divided between Ally and Soviet powers. Because Ally-controlled West Berlin is locked behind Soviet borders and cut off from all land transport, the people of the city must rely entirely on air support for all their supplies.

Play as a pilot in Operation Candy Bomber and work cooperatively with the other players to strategize how best to use each character’s strengths to fly missions in and out of West Berlin and help the people avoid starvation under the threat of Soviet control.

Each turn, the players draw a card to see which area of West Berlin eats their rations. It is up to the players (with a limited number of actions) to drop off rations or candy to the people. Candy will be taken at the same time as rations and when enough candy is taken, players get rewarded in the form of postcards.

While players are trying to keep the people alive, winter is slowly creeping in, making the game harder and harder. Eventually it becomes too cold and the planes can no longer take off, which will end the game unless players have completed the required number of operations, which are essentially missions.

—description from the publisher

Treasure Road is a light game for casual gamers. It features computer game design elements such as yellow boxes, coins and pixel graphics.

Players try to collect all of their coins on the board before the other players do.

Gameplay: the player draws three cards that can have three actions: move, spin an adjacent tile, spin any tile on the game board. The player moves his/her character on the board to get all of his/her coins while blocking the ways of the other players.

At the same time, an automated villain tries to steal the collected coins from the players.

Action boxes enable players to perform special actions that help the player, or that hinder opponents.

The player who collects all of his/her coins first wins.

—description from the designer

item.description:
Who will manage to create the most successful zoo? To do so, you need to know how to choose and feed your animals by collecting points.

Players take turns to either take two "food" cards or take one "animal" card. However, to take one "animal" card you need to have the necessary number of "food" cards corresponding to that animal's diet. You then discard those cards during your turn. If you win an "animal" card, you place it in your zoo, in front of you. Once you have finished your turn, replace the card you took with another one from the "animal" draw pile.

You win by being the player with the most stars on your cards at the end.

Players can win bonuses for having a range of different animals in their zoo, or having themed zoos.

Unlock! Secret Adventures features three "escape room" scenarios that you can play on your tabletop.

Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc. The three scenarios are...


 "A Noside Story"
 "Tombstone Express"
 "The Adventurers of Oz"

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

item.description:
Quantum Quest is a standalone card game that challenges two or more players to put together teams of stalwart adventurers to outlast their opponents in a living dungeon. Electrifying spells, sinister traps and treacherous monsters stand in the way of survival, but things only grow more difficult when the heroes start acquiring chambers in the dungeon. Escape is futile; survive while you can!

In Quantum Quest, each player takes control of a party of five adventurers, and goes through a dungeon of at least twenty chambers, with more added for every additional player over two. This dungeon crawl is always different, thanks to the assortment of cards. Almost all of these chambers exist for only one purpose: to put the hurting on the adventurers.

Player's spend mana to control these chambers, which serves two purposes: first, they can no longer harm their owners; second, the owner decides how their enemies take damage when landing on these rooms. It's a fun, spiteful way to come out on top!

Quantum Quest also benefits from an interesting end-game phase. If all your adventurers perish in the dungeon, you're not kicked out of the game. All the rooms you owned before your untimely demise remain yours, and get a boost since they're haunted. You can choose to deal double damage to your surviving foes when they land in these chambers!

You are a druid apprentice. There are many kinds of virtues that are necessary for a druid, but the most important thing is harmony with nature. You have to make your own ecosystem as the last gateway to become a druid.
Only one person who has created the best ecosystem among the various competitors can get the title of a druid.
Now, are you ready?

To create an ecosystem, you need to bring the plants and animals that you need. Then put down the cards in hand to make food chains, and these food chains come together to form your own ecosystem. Get scores by creating more and higher food chains. Also achieve missions on the Druid’s Scrolls to score. Only the one with the highest score becomes the new druid.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Home Designers is a competitive game that trains memory, insight and imagination. Experience the role of designers who build dream houses for demanding clients. The one who is best able to meet their wishes and at the same time meet the general requirements for the quality of housing will become the winner.

Each player receives their land on which they try to build the best house. The first phase of the game consists in drafting (selecting) rooms (1 room = 1 building). The second phase in assembling the rooms together. Everything is shown in a top view, as a ground plan. The client is always a family member common to all players. 1 family member = 1 card. Each member of the family has three different requirements that players will earn points for.

Home Designers is a family game of medium difficulty. Rules are not complicated, but building a good living can be challenging.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Winston Cup NASCAR Team Trivia Game

item.description:
Nascar Trivia! It brings the thrills of racing right into your living room! It is a Collector's First Edition Game , and only 25,000 were ever made!

Relive the exciting record-setting performances by the legends of stock car racing. When you answer the questions correctly, you advance around the NASCAR Winston Cup, International Raceway; Completing Laps, Pit Stops, Making unbelievable passes and experiencing unfortunate encounters with retaining walls.

Will your Knowledge and Luck drive you to the checkered flag?

name.value: Pull Your Card: Hip Hop Edition

item.description:
A multiple choice trivia card game. The first deck is dedicated to Hip Hop.

Each deck includes Pick any Player, Reverse, and Skip cards.

Other expansion packs consist of Reggae, Pop, Movies, TV, etc.

—description from the designer

The King is throwing a surprise birthday brunch for the Queen and needs your help. As one of the kingdom's greatest chicken farmers it is up to you to supply the eggs. Unfortunately not all eggs are perfect for her favorite dish.

The game is playable with two to five players. Play time is about 30 minutes.

Players collect sets of chicken cards in order to draw random egg tokens from the Coop bag, but beware; some of the eggs are rotten and can end your turn when drawn.

—description from the designer

name.value: The Red Flag is Still: The Third Counter Encirclement Campaign

item.description:
The Red Flag is Still: The Third Counter Encirclement Campaign in Central Soviet is a two-player wargame of the third encirclement campaign against Jiangxi Soviet in 1931 during the Chinese Civil War.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_Encirclement_Campaign_against_Jiangxi_Soviet

This is a simple game of WWII tank combat in order to make good use of World Tank Museum, a series of miniature tanks produced by Kaiyodo.
Game components are one rulebook, one double-sided map, eighty tactical cards, fourteen mission cards, twenty seven tank cards and cardboard counters. World Tank Museum miniatures (or any other miniature tanks) substitute for cardboard counters.

This is a simple game of the battle between JGSDF tanks and gigantic monsters in order to make good use of World Tank Museum, a series of miniature tanks produced by Kaiyodo.
Game components are one rulebook, one double-sided map, eighty tactical cards, fourteen mission cards, twenty seven tank cards and cardboard counters. World Tank Museum miniatures (or any other miniature tanks) substitute for cardboard counters.

DeckPerception is a fun and interactive tabletop game in the classic tradition. Players use their powers of perception and deduction to make predictive guesses about their card--which they can't see but the other players can.

For 3-4 players age 12 and up. Game play is 15-20 minutes. Game includes special DeckPerception cards, card holders, score sheets, pencil, and rules, packaged in an attractive and sturdy box. A great game for families, middle school and high school students, and adults (while enjoying adult beverages or otherwise).

Game Play

Game play is simple, highly interactive, and fun. Players are dealt one card each, which are placed in card holders so they can't see them but the other players can. Using the other players' cards, guesses, and reactions as clues, players use their skills of perception and deduction to predict the rank, the range, and eventually the number of their unseen card over several rounds of guessing. Guesses are marked on the included score sheets, which facilitate game play. At the end of the hand players look at their cards and receive points for correct guesses. The player with the most points after four hands wins.

—description from the publisher

The Legendary War - Mahabharat Edition is a role playing, deck building game which can be played as duel (1v1) or as team game of (2v2 or 3v3 players). Ancient history is combined with deck building mechanism.The game is based on an ancient war which happened thousand of years ago and resulted in over one and a half billion casualties. The war only lasted for 18 days.

There are 14 characters divided into 2 teams (each team has 7 characters,--- blue and red team) in this game each having special ability, belonging to a particular faction (Archer, swordsmen, Spearmen, Macewielder). All of them have health points and defense value.

There are money cards (silver) and infantry cards to start the game , which are shuffled to form drawing deck. There are money cards (Gold), weapon cards (spear, mace, swords, bow & arrow), Potion cards which form trade row. Each weapon card has cost, value, and extra ability on them.

In this game the players draw initiative cards depending on number of players playing. The player drawing no 1 initiative card chooses either blue or red team and draws a random character. Each player gets initial money cards and attack cards and shuffle them to form their drawing deck. Out of which they draw 5 cards as starting hand and buy cards from trade row. The players have to raise their army by buying weapon cards from trade row. These cards help them to draw more cards, trash cards, add more money, add more attack points etc.

The players attack each other and resolving combat by either direct hit or by rolling dice if attack is equal to defense. The game ends when opponent/opponent team is eliminated.

—description from the publisher

In Red HINT, your teammates have to guess what you are trying to tell them. Along the way you both mime, draw, hum and talk about everything from 'European Capitals' and 'Movie Villains' to 'Songs about wink' and 'Pizza Fill'. You must be both quick and creative, but beware! There is always one forbidden word that you may not use. An entertaining party game for everyone that gets the hint.

The game plays like "ordinary" HINT, but two of the categories have been changed.

Fublet is the ultimate, highly strategic, easy to learn/hard to master football simulation board game; play as the head coach of your team, select your eleven starters, take your trusted blackboard and show them the tactics you’re going to use to win this match, but make sure you pick the right choices, also according to their own skills, or you’ll fail miserably!

In Fublet you can simulate all real football actions and tactics: you can try to tricky dribble your opponent in order to create a power play chance, make a penetrative pass or a quick cross towards your world class striker, trap into offside position an opponent forward, use a zone or a man to man marking defense or even focus on long or short “tiki-taka” style passes.

The choice is yours and remember, the more accurately you follow the tactics you have chosen, the more movement points you collect; by spending them you’ll be able to move your players on the field, one by one or even by zone(defense, midfield and attack), in order to face your opponent’s strategy and pursue your way for the goal!

This is an updated standalone version of the original game, which appeared in Yaah! Magazine issue 6.

Lion of Malaya is an operational level game covering the Japanese invasion of Malaya and the advance to Singapore between December 1941 and February 1942. It is a two-player simulation. One player controls the Imperial Japanese Army (and some Navy units), and the other player controls the British Imperial and Commonwealth forces assembled to defend the peninsula and the important naval base.

From the introduction in the rule book:

"This game is designed to be a tactical simulation of small scale gang warfare actions involving the car in what must be considered to be the first use of mechanised troops in a fast moving tactical situation."

The game features rules for table-top skirmishes between 1920s gangsters in America, armed with a variety of weapons and driving a variety of vehicles.

BLOCK WAR is a 2-player card game based on one of the greatest story arcs in Judge Dredd™ history.

Players act as ‘Perps’ in their respective Blocks, when Block War breaks out. Blast the enemy, reinforce your gangs, or just drop a Boing™ on the Justice Department who is trying to stop you.

Each player controls 5 windows on their side of the street. Place your gangs and open your windows to attack and close them to defend yourself. Down on “The Street” the Justice Department has responded to the disturbance and have joined the battle. Not only are you attacking your opponent, you are attacking the Justice Department that is sworn to stop you. Strategically open/close your windows to defend yourself from the never ending onslaught that is facing you. But Watch Out! They’ve called in a Manta Tank! One shot destroys your window, and if you’re really unlucky, you’ll face Judge Dredd Himself.

The Judge Dredd: Block War cardgame was specifically designed to be as brutal a game to play as it is to exist in Mega-City One.

Standard trivia style game with questions specifically geared to an American audience.

Learn all about your country with the American Trivia Game! This one-of-a-kind game was created exclusively for Books Are Fun and features over 2,000 fun-filled, all-American questions in four categories—Geography, History, Arts, and General. You’ll discover: Who signed the Declaration of Independence first? The second largest city in Oklahoma Who wrote the poem “America the Beautiful”? Which team won back-to-back Super Bowls during the 1990s? And more! Complete with full-color game board, instruction sheet, 540 playing cards, 8 playing pieces, and 30 “Uncle Sam” cards, it’s the perfect way to brush up on all the fascinating facts and figures about the United States. For ages 12 and up.

Based on the uproarious funny “F in Exams” book series, this game uses real test answers from the books that’ll make players laugh while they determine the correct answers. Players use the poker chips provided to earn points for correct answers but they should be careful – if they choose the wrong answer they will lose a chip!

Trivia Cards about Music.

1000 Questions.

Sister Deck to Trivia on the Go America. Decks can be combined.
A table top version of the classic party game beer pong. Mini beer pong is played head to head using catapults to launch small tethered balls into the opposing teams shot cups.

Palm Island is a portable game that you can take with you anywhere. Sitting, standing, waiting, riding, flying, relaxing, alone, or together you can play Palm Island no table required.

Using a deck transforming mechanic a player uses just 17 cards over 8 rounds to shape their island and overcome its unique challenges. Store resources to pay for upgrades and upgrade buildings to access new abilities. Each decision you make will alter your village from round to round. At the end of 8 rounds calculate your victory points.

Each card has four states or positions. The face-up, top section is the active area on each card and represents the card's current state. Through upgrading your cards with rotate and flip allowing you to access the other sections of each card and improve your village by increasing resource production and gaining more victory points.

While playing solo, players can achieve feats by meeting specific criteria during their games. Once they have earned a feat, it's card can be used in all future games. Collect more feats for more abilities and score even more points.

While playing with others you may play cooperatively working together to successfully prepare your village before natural disasters strike. These disasters scale based on player count allowing you to combine multiple copies of the game for more players or even play these challenges solo. You can also play competitively racing to recruit valuable new members for you village and use their abilities to score more points than your opponent.

The game comes with 2 player decks, competitive cards, cooperative cards and solo feat cards. Multiple games can be combined to add even more players.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The Norse god Ullr was god of both skiing and hunting, is this were the roots of biathlon lies?
Military in scandinavia trained with skies and rifles, was it in this competetive enviroment biathlon was born?

Well... who cares? Born from the gods or from the military we can all agree that biathlon is a fascinating sport. Hard to master but wonderful to spectate.

Now you are given the chance to take control of your nation during the biathlon "Ski tour". Guide your skier through a tough course, keep up with your rivals, make your move and sprint at the right time. Remember to always control your stamina so that your shots at the firing range have a chance to hit the target. You dont want to take a lap in the penalty lane. Also your stamina is surposed to last for the entire race...don't rush into the lead before the first corner.

Play one of your nations unique action cards at the right time to get the upper hand. Make bold moves past your opponents or force your rivals into positions where they must waste energy beeing stuck in the middle of the field of skiers.

However you plan your race, the glory goes to the skier who is first to cross the finish line. There can only be one SKI TOUR CHAMPION!

—description from the publisher

Each player selects a color and places the corresponding candles, rosettes, and marbles on top the plastic cake in front of them. One player turns over a card from the deck, which will show one of the numbers that matches the numbers on the rosettes. Simultaneously all players will try to blow the marble off their numbered candle. The marbles that are successfully blown off will fall into the middle of the cake and down a chute. The player whose marble falls down the chute first wins the round. All other players must put their marbles back onto their candles.

The first player to blow all 4 of their candles out wins.

Broken Axles is a 15mm vehicle combat game set in a retro sci-fi, post apocalyptic world. Warbands of raiders roam the Endless Desert, vying with each other for dominance over vital supplies of Crude Oil and refined Cruel with which to sustain their ever-thirsty warmachines. Such prizes are no easy prey, however, as often times these resources are carried in the armoured bellies of massive Battle Rigs, bristling with weaponry and surrounded by escort vehicles.

The rules are fast and bloody, where every dice roll can range from triumphant execution to disastrous mishap, conveying the nature of the ramshackle vehicles each player utilizes. Crush your opponents with bouts of metal-crunching road rage, explosive Boomsticks and potent mounted weapons, or die trying.

—description from the publisher

It's been twenty years since Victor Frankenstein died on a ship in the arctic, but his vengeful creature lives on, as does Robert Walton, the sea captain who vowed to kill the fiend before mercy stayed his hand. It's now 1819, and a sinister darkness descends upon the city of Paris. A mysterious benefactor of gigantic stature has emerged in the scientific community, never showing his face, claiming to possess the late Frankenstein's research. He sponsors a grand competition, offering an even grander prize: unlocking the mystery of mortality!

Renowned scientists from around the world come to take part: some drawn to solve this eternal riddle, others coerced against their will. But a certain captain comes as well, one deeply suspicious of the secretive patron, hoping to finally fulfill his vow.

Abomination: The Heir of Frankenstein is a competitive game of strategic monster building for 2-4 players, inspired by Mary Shelley's classic novel of gothic horror. In the game, the creature demands your help to accomplish what his own creator would not: to bring to life an abomination like itself, a companion to end its miserable solitude. Through worker placement and careful management of decomposing resources, you'll gather materials from the cemeteries and morgues around the city, conduct valuable research at the Academy of Science, hire less-than-reputable associates, and toil away in your lab — all in an effort to assemble a new form of life and infuse it with a "spark of being". Do well, and the creature may reward you during one of its surprise visits; do poorly, and you may come to regret not putting forth more effort. Narrative elements come into play throughout the game, guided by your decisions, leading to potentially unsavory outcomes.

The game ends when you succeed in bringing your creation to life or when the Captain kills the creature, whichever happens first. Then the player with the most points fulfills Frankenstein's dark legacy, becoming his heir, for good or ill...

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Nothing is more fun than living A Season in Springfield, where all people tend to be of a good yellow and have four fingers for each hand and foot! All you have to do is choose an interesting job and decide, time to time, whether to use your time or money to do any kind of action: marrying, having children, adopting a pig, fishing a fish with three eyes, becoming mayor, become a mason, open a left-handed shop, create a new flaming cocktail or join the latest local star movie.
Come on! What are you doing there yet?

In the game are four types of cards: Job cards, School/Wedding cards, Start Season cards and End Season Cards. First you must draw a Job card. You may also choose to attend school which allows you to pick a higher paying career, but you also lose three turns. Your Job card lists how much time and money you can spend on each turn. On your turn, you may play cards from your hand, but only if you have enough time or money to pay for them. The cards you play feature life goals that are worth points. When the Early Life cards are used up, play proceeds with the Later Life cards. This deck also has the Letter cards "B" "A" "R" and "T", and when all four of these cards are drawn the game ends. 
The players add up their scores and the one with the highest point total wins.

—description from the publisher

link.value: The Game of Life: Card Game

item.description:
The players must help Max the farmer to harvest all the vegetables, but watch out! Because if you get a worm you lose the whole harvest and you'll also have the harvest before the crow reaches the market garden and eats all the vegetables.

All the players work to achieve the objective together. In a COOPERATIVE game the top priority is for everyone to achieve a goal together.


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


Los jugadores deberán ayudar a Max el granjero a cosechar todas las hortalizas, pero ¡cuidado!, porque si te salelun gusano pierdes toda la cosecha y además deberás intentar cosechar antes de que llegue el cuervo al huerto y se coma todas las hortalizas.

Todos los jugadores trabajan para conseguir juntos el objetivo. En un juego COOPERATIVO lo prioritario es conseguir un objetivo entre todos.

In Break Free, you and up to three other agents are locked in handcuffs, testing your espionage skills together. Your goal is to escape from the cuffs more quickly than anyone else because whoever frees themselves first scores the most points!

Break Free comes with twelve unique mazes with three difficulty levels. Players must handcuff themselves and break free by using the lock pick, moving it up and down and twisting it left and right to escape!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
What the wolf is coming! The wolf is coming! All the players must help the sheep mother to take the sheep to the barn before the wolf arrives at the meadow and makes his own. With this game all the players COOPERATE to achieve the objective.

¡Que viene el lobo!, ¡Que viene el lobo!, todos los jugadores deberán ayudar a mamá oveja a llevar a las ovejitas al establo antes de que el lobo llegue al prado y haga de las suyas. Con éste juego todos los jugadores COOPERAN para conseguir el objetivo.

Model and guess without saying the prohibited answer!

Use plasticine to model the pictures that appear on the cards so that the other players an guess what you're doing.

But watch out! On each other card there's a prohibited picture and if another player names it you'll both lose points.

¡Modela y adivina sin decir la respuesta prohibida!

Modela con plastilina los dibujos que aparecen en las tarjetas para conseguir que los otros jugadores adivinen qué estás haciendo.

Pero cuidado, en cada tarjeta hay un dibujo prohibido, y si otro jugador lo nombra ambos perderéis puntos.
Memory game that teaches you to draw exciting figures. Each figure is drawn in four stages, and you have to draw the four cards corresponding to each figure in the right order. (User summary)

You can not stop laughing with this game. Grab all the fruits and vegetables you can from the feeder before the shift passes, but do it with your gluttony pig snout and listen to how the feeder sounds when you try. Guaranteed fun!

A trip around the world of books.

Travel with us: travel the world of literature from the living room of your home with our exclusive board game.

Have fun with LiteraTour, the challenge of readers:


 Círculo's exclusive board game to enjoy as a family.



 Play as if it were a parchís or put yourself to the test with questions and challenges.



 Have fun while learning about literature.


LiteraTour is an entertaining and educational board game. It has different levels of complexity and with it you can demonstrate your literary knowledge and spend pleasant evenings with your friends or with your family.

There are two types of game: the traditional one, similar to the classic parchís, and the advanced, which incorporates questions and challenges that dynamize and complicate each game a bit. Do not worry, there are questions and challenges of different levels so that both big and small have a chance to win.

Christmas Tree: The Decorating is a quick 2* player game of building and decorating a Christmas Tree!

Each turn, a player places 1 card to build the communal tree and scores their matching bulb clusters and adjacent ornaments.

Cards are double sided, can be played upright, upside-down, and in some cases, on-top of other cards! The direction of the tree's orientation is not predetermined either. When the last card is placed and scored, the player with the highest score wins!

*Build bigger Trees (3-4 players) with an additional copy!

—description from the publisher
